history.content:
I would say to do both because you'll get the full experience. During live lecture, you can absorb a lot of what the professor is saying and finding your initial questions/answers. Later, you can look at the slides to see if your understanding is the same etc.

===============================================================

Assuming there are existing class notes or a textbook, I'd say read those before going to lecture so then you can focus taking notes on the important / non-redundant parts like you mentioned earlier.

---- 

I would agree with the above. If possible, I would read the slides beforehand (assuming it is posted) and then really take in the material during lecture. Personally, I just take notes during lecture since i don't really have the time to pre-read, but if I did have the time, I would definitely try it out.

I would say to do both because you'll get the full experience. During live lecture, you can absorb a lot of what the professor is saying and finding your initial questions/answers. Later, you can look at the slides to see if your understanding is the same etc.

===============================================================

Assuming there are existing class notes or a textbook, I'd say read those before going to lecture so then you can focus taking notes on the important / non-redundant parts like you mentioned earlier.

I would say to do both because you'll get the full experience. During live lecture, you can absorb a lot of what the professor is saying and finding your initial questions/answers. Later, you can look at the slides to see if your understanding is the same etc.

1. What are people's opinions on taking notes during lecture? I think the best way is probably not taking notes, but having paper and pen ready in case the professor says something important. In addition, writing down answers to your questions, and certain questions you have but don't get a chance to ask, and certain topics you didn't really understand during the lecture.

(This is the method I want to try for next semester, so if anyone wants to add suggestions, happy to read)

2. But since I won't be taking notes of the material, I will rewatch lecture or reread slides. Does anyone have suggestions as to which one to do? I'm leaning towards slides, since that usually takes me much less time to finish over watching lecture.
history.subject: Taking Notes During Lecture + Rewatching Lecture vs Slides
